title: Lin-Manuel Miranda skipping Oscars due to wife's positive Covid test
description: Director, composer and actor Lin-Manuel Miranda, who is Oscar nominated for best original song for his work on the film "Encanto," said he will skip Sunday's Academy Awards because his wife has tested positive for Covid.

title: Analysis: Ketanji Brown Jackson is the most popular US Supreme Court nominee in years
description: Two news stories dominated the headlines this week. The ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine reached its one month mark. And the Senate hosted confirmation hearings for Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to join the Supreme Court.

title: California man charged with smuggling hundreds of reptiles from Mexico, Hong Kong
description: A California man has been charged with smuggling more than a thousand reptiles, some endangered, into the United States.

title: F1 driver Mick Schumacher released from hospital after crash during qualifying of Saudi Arabian Grand Prix
description: Formula One driver Mick Schumacher said he was "OK" after he was transported to the hospital Saturday following a scary crash during the qualifying for the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix, according to a post from his Twitter account.

title: New Jersey man arrested after 12-year-old nephew dies of fentanyl intoxication
description: A man who was allegedly manufacturing fentanyl in his New Jersey apartment faces almost 30 charges after his 12-year-old nephew died following exposure to paraphernalia containing the substance, the Camden County prosecutor's office said.

title: 8 takeaways from Biden's trip to Europe
description: President Joe Biden used a last-minute trip to Europe this week to rally the world's democracies and announce more actions against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, while also causing a geopolitical stir with one of the final lines from his speech in Poland.

title: The Oscars: Three times when real events challenged whether the show must go on
description: Like any awards show, the Oscars are built on the inherently self-absorbed notion that what happens in the room and who takes home the trophies matters, in what should be a welcome distraction from the outside world.

title: US response: Biden calls Putin 'a butcher'
description: President Joe Biden on Saturday called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "butcher" after visiting with refugees in Warsaw, Poland, marking another escalation in his criticism of the Russian leader as the war in Ukraine enters its second month.

title: Parents of teen who fell to his death from an amusement park ride hire attorneys
description: The parents of a teen who fell to his death from a Florida amusement park ride have hired attorneys, who are seeking witnesses of the incident.

title: How to save the Amazon? Brazil company says NFTs are the answer
description: A Brazilian company that owns 410 square kilometers (158 square miles) of Amazon rainforest is offering a new way to fund conservation: selling non-fungible tokens that allow buyers to sponsor the preservation of specific areas of jungle.

title: CNN's Don Lemon reports from airstrike aftermath
This Pokémon card just sold for $420,000 at auction
description: In a bid to catch all the Pokémon, someone just paid $420,000 at auction for a Charizard card.

title: A beekeeper, a builder and a homeless man: The civilian victims of Putin's invasion
description: Beekeeper Dmitry Mulyar was tending to his hives outside his home in eastern Kyiv when the Russian shelling hit on Thursday morning.

title: Rare 'pay copy' of Marvel's first comic book sells for $2.4 million
description: A rare copy of Marvel's first-ever comic book has netted more than $2.4 million at auction.

title: 'Bridgerton' returns with Regency-era romance that simmers just beneath the surface
description: Oh, to be Lady Whistledown on "Bridgerton."

title: This recession indicator is flashing a warning sign
description: The bond market is flashing a warning sign that has correctly predicted almost every recession over the past 60 years: a potential inversion of the US Treasury note yield curve.

title: Opinion: Zelensky's Ukraine is real. Putin's doesn't exist
description: "If things had turned out the way my mother wanted, I would have been a violinist," Volodymyr Zelensky said in a standup routine on his late-night variety show, "Kvartal-95." "That's right, as a good Jewish boy, I played the violin as a kid." That Zelensky is a good Jewish boy presents a problem for Vladimir Putin, who has repeatedly accused Ukraine of fascism and even anti-Semitism.

title: Shooting that killed 2, including reporter and former CNN news assistant, occurred over a spilled drink, police say
description: A March 19 shooting in Norfolk, Virginia, that left two dead, including a Virginian-Pilot reporter and former CNN news assistant, followed an argument over a spilled drink, Norfolk Police Sgt. William D. Pickering Jr., told CNN Friday.

title: The all-women newsroom at the heart of Oscar-nominated 'Writing With Fire' holds power to account
description: To watch "Writing With Fire" is to get a crash course in journalism fundamentals.

title: Foo Fighters drummer Taylor Hawkins has died, band says
description: Taylor Hawkins, the drummer for the legendary US rock band Foo Fighters, has died, the band said Friday. He was 50.

title: Woman whose town was overrun describes strange behavior by Russian soldiers
description: CNN's Sam Kiley visits a hospital in Brovary, Ukraine, and speaks to victims of Russia's military invasion.

title: Why your kid's crush should be taken seriously
description: I recently asked my third grade son about crushes in his class. After two years of having limited interaction with human beings, I had to turn to him -- the only person in our house who regularly socializes, albeit with his fellow 8- and 9-year-olds -- for a gossip fix.

title: F1 organizers insist Saudi Arabian Grand Prix will go ahead despite Houthi attack on nearby oil facility
description: Race organizers confirmed the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix will take place this weekend despite an attack claimed by Yemen's Houthi rebels on an oil storage facility near the track on Friday.

title: New book reveals real stories behind history's most unforgettable Oscar looks
description: The Academy Awards are all about who takes home the golden statuette, but also who looks best doing so. Celebrities come at Oscar fashion culture from a variety of angles, whether they arrive at the ceremony dressed to the nines or blaze past traditional decorum.

title: A 14-year-old fell to his death from the new drop tower ride at Florida's ICON Park, authorities say
description: A 14-year-old boy died after he fell Thursday night from a drop tower amusement ride that recently opened at the Orlando area's ICON Park entertainment complex, authorities said.

title: The people donating their rental homes to refugees
description: On 24 February, as she watched the news of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Desislava Tosheva was staring at her couch.

title: These are some of the historical sites at risk in Kyiv
description: When Vladimir Putin's forces last approached a capital city, they leveled it.

title: Remains of a woman who went missing 33 years ago has been identified. Now authorities will look for her killer
description: For more than 33 years, investigators in Norton Shores, Michigan, tried to figure out what happened to Stacey Lyn Chahorski, a young woman who left home to travel the country and last spoke to her mother in September 1988.

title: Florida man dies after crashing his car into an 11-foot alligator
description: A Florida man has died after crashing his car into an 11-foot alligator.

title: Netflix has been trying to win best picture. This might finally be the year
description: Netflix has accomplished a lot in Hollywood: It's partnered with notable filmmakers, produced buzzy hit films and launched the streaming craze that revolutionized the industry.

title: What the second month of war in Ukraine may bring
description: Russia's brutal and unprovoked invasion of Ukraine has entered its second month with scores of civilians dead, entire communities leveled, and perhaps most troubling, no end in sight.

title: Solar Orbiter swings by the sun to unravel its mysteries
description: The Solar Orbiter mission will make its closest flyby of the sun Saturday since launching in February 2020.

title: Here's what to remember about Trump, Ukraine and Putin
description: The Russian invasion of Ukraine didn't just happen out of nowhere.

title: Tonight is Earth Hour. Here's how you can participate
description: Tonight, for the 15th consecutive year, people around the world will turn off their lights for one hour. It's part of a grassroots global campaign called Earth Hour.

title: Jury awards more than $10 million to family of Gilbert Flores, who was fatally shot by deputies
description: Jurors in a federal civil trial awarded $10.37 million to the family of Gilbert Flores, who was shot and killed outside his home by Bexar County, Texas, sheriff's deputies in 2015.

title: Montana hiker found dead after suspected grizzly bear attack
description: A hiker who had been reported missing in Montana earlier this week was found dead Friday after a suspected encounter with a grizzly bear.

title: Maine teen accused of plotting to attack a Chicago area mosque
description: Federal prosecutors have accused a Maine teen of plotting to attack a Chicago-area mosque and charged him with possession of a destructive device.

title: GSA approves sale of Trump Organization's Washington hotel lease
description: The General Services Administration has approved the buyer of the lease for the Trump Organization's luxury hotel in Washington, paving the way for the deal to move forward.
